intro: Anticharis brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed anticharis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Anticharis brevipes is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
